videos.alt_text: adidas Originals - Original Is Never Finished
videos.title: adidas Originals - Original Is Never Finished (2018)
videos.description: The second installment of the now iconic Original is Never Finished campaign. We'd identify this clip as a pedestal shot VFX breakdown. As we ascend higher, the post-production begins to fall away until all that is left is the studio it was shot in.
videos.additional_info:
adidas Originals - Original Is Never Finished (2018)
The second installment of the now iconic Original is Never Finished campaign. We'd identify this clip as a pedestal shot VFX breakdown. As we ascend higher, the post-production begins to fall away until all that is left is the studio it was shot in.
Technique - BTS , Pedestal
Director - Manu Cossu
DOP - Mattias Rudh
Editor - Christie Brown, Gian Buazulli
Colorist - Company 3, Tom Poole

videos.alt_text: Lil Nas X, Youngboy Never Broke Again - Late To Da Party
videos.title: Lil Nas X, Youngboy Never Broke Again - Late To Da Party (2022)
videos.description: The music video for "Late to da Party (F*ck BET)" by Lil Nas X and YoungBoy Never Broke Again features provocative imagery, including Lil Nas X urinating on a BET Award, to criticize and satirize the entertainment industry, particularly for Lil Nas X's exclusion from BET Awards nominations.

videos.title: Yung Jake - Unfollow (2014)
videos.description: "Unfollow" by Yung Jake, presented on MOCAtv, explores the challenge of moving on from a past relationship in the digital era, emphasizing the difficulty of severing ties through social media. The music video captures the emotional turmoil and the haunting presence of past memories amplified by social media feeds. It artistically portrays the struggle of detaching from a former partner in a world where digital connections persistently remind one of the past.
videos.additional_info:
Yung Jake - Unfollow (2014)
"Unfollow" by Yung Jake, presented on MOCAtv, explores the challenge of moving on from a past relationship in the digital era, emphasizing the difficulty of severing ties through social media. The music video captures the emotional turmoil and the haunting presence of past memories amplified by social media feeds. It artistically portrays the struggle of detaching from a former partner in a world where digital connections persistently remind one of the past.
Technique - BTS , Two Shot
Director - Yung Jake
DOP - Temra Pavlovic
Original Source - Link

videos.title: Rema - Trouble Maker (2023)
videos.description: The "Trouble Maker" music video by Rema, directed by Meji Alabi, features vibrant visuals and dynamic choreography that emphasize themes of triumph and resilience. Enhanced by Blaisebeatz's production, it provides a cinematic experience that complements the track's infectious beats. The video showcases Rema's unique style and artistic versatility.
videos.additional_info:
Rema - Trouble Maker (2023)
The "Trouble Maker" music video by Rema, directed by Meji Alabi, features vibrant visuals and dynamic choreography that emphasize themes of triumph and resilience. videos.title: Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
videos.additional_info:
Doechii - DENIAL IS A RIVER (2025)
Doechii's "Denial Is a River" (2025) reimagines her life as a '90s sitcom, inspired by Family Matters, with a nostalgic title sequence and a star-studded cast including Zack Fox, ScHoolboy Q, and Teezo Touchdown. Blending humor and introspection, the video playfully navigates sitcom-style scenarios that reflect her personal and professional journey. Directors: Carlos Acosta & James Mackel EPs: Moosa Tiffith & Anthony ‚ÄúTop Dawg‚Äù Tiffith Production Company: LOTUMN Executive Producer / Producer: Autumn Maschi Executive Producer: Loris Russier Creative Director: Doechii, Moosa Tiffith, & BMR.Nem Director of Photography: Nico Aguilar Production Designer: Hensel Martinez TDE Creative Producer: Langston Siebens Production Manager: Kai Lusk Production Coordinator: Kate Kramnaia, Alex Turner 1st AD: Daniel Bennaiem 2nd AD: Delaney Forrey 1st AC: Hannah Lee 2nd AC: McKay Todd, Marianna Vashchilenko DIT: Pete Aguirre Camera Operator: Chloe Smolkin, Cordell Jomha
